text: To use Google Flights,

navigate to Google.com/flights
on your PC or Mac.
Click on "Round trip"

and choose what type of
ticket you're looking for
from the drop-down menu.

If you're traveling to
more than one location,
select "Multi-city,"
and another flight should pop up.
You can add up to five locations
by clicking "Add flight."
Now click on one passenger
to select how many tickets you need.
You can add or subtract passengers
with the plus or minus options.
Then click on "Economy" to select
the class of ticket you're looking for.
Put the name of the city or airport
you want to fly out of here
and where your final destination is here.
Choose the date you want to leave,
and for a round-trip flight,
the day you want to return.
When all your info is in, click "Search,"

and you'll see a list of
flights on the next page.
You can create a Google Flight alert
to track the prices of these flights
by toggling "Track prices" here.
You'll get an email every time
the price of the flight drops.

You can change the order
and comparison of flights
by clicking the arrows next to "Sort by."
To continue booking your trip,
select the flights you want.

On the next page, you'll
see relevant information,
such as baggage costs.

Under "Booking options,"
click the blue "Select" box
next to the airline or travel site

that you'd like to
purchase your ticket from.
You'll now be able to buy your flights
either directly from Google,

or you'll be directed
to the airline's site.
Safe travels!
